subject: RE: [junit] Re: Using JUnit for Performance Tests?
msgSnippet: Also, there s a product called Enhanced Junit that adds distributed load testing of JUnit tests across multiple VMs and processors to JUnit. You can download
messageBody:
Also, there's a product called "Enhanced Junit" that adds distributed
load testing of JUnit tests across multiple VMs and processors to JUnit.
You can download it and read a bit about it at
http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit/.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

> From: Dave Astels [mailto:dave@...]

> Subject: [junit] Re: Using JUnit for Performance Tests?
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "javainsel" <javainsel@y...> wrote:
> > Would you use JUnit for performance tests?
>
> Yes, for some types.
>
> Check out JUnitPerf by Mike Clark at
>
http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

Dave
